official-title.#text:
To establish the Brownfield Redevelopment and Economic Development Innovative Financing program to
			 promote urban renewal, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Brownfield Redevelopment and Economic Development Innovative Financing Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Brownfield Redevelopment and Economic Development Innovative Financing Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Brownfield Redevelopment and Economic Development Innovative Financing Program

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Housing and Urban Development

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
,
			 shall establish a program, to be known as the Brownfield Redevelopment and
			 Economic Development Innovative Financing program, under which the

may guarantee, and make commitments to guarantee, the repayment
			 of principal and interest on loans made by lenders to local governments,
			 local redevelopment agencies, or BRAC redevelopment projects for the
			 purposes of carrying out projects for redeveloping brownfields and
			 promoting urban renewal.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
(at such time and in such form
			 as the

text.#text:
A local government, local redevelopment agency, or BRAC redevelopment project shall be eligible to
			 receive a loan guarantee under the Program only if such government,
			 agency, or project submits to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Brownfield Redevelopment and Economic Development Innovative Financing Act of 2014/s:2/ss:c

text.#text: a master plan that meets the requirements under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , or an entity designated by the

, that the brownfield to be redeveloped
			 under the master plan requires environmental remediation; and

text.#text: a certification from the
any other information as the
A loan may be guaranteed under the Program only if the loan meets the following requirements:
acquisition of a brownfield site;
remediation of a brownfield site;
relocation of existing facilities in operation on the redevelopment site; or

site preparation, including the installation of utilities, sewers, storm drains, and transportation
			 facilities.

Such loan shall be used for costs of carrying out a project to redevelop brownfields and promote
			 urban renewal, which may include—

A local government, local redevelopment agency, or BRAC redevelopment project may not receive a
			 loan guarantee under the Program if the applying agency was responsible
			 for contaminating a brownfield to be redeveloped using such loan.

A local government, local redevelopment agency, or BRAC redevelopment project may not at any time
			 have more than one outstanding loan that is guaranteed under the Program.
be less than $25,000,000; and
exceed the lesser of—
the total cost of the redevelopment project for which the loan is to be used; or
The original principal amount of such loan shall not—

Such loan shall bear interest at a rate negotiated between the lender and the borrower, subject to
			 any limitations that the
The term to maturity of such loan shall not be shorter than 20 years nor longer than 30 years.

shall not require any repayment of principal or interest within 10 years after the date that the
			 lender makes the loan to the borrower; and

shall require that repayment shall begin not later than 15 years after the date that such loan is
			 made.
Such loan—

A master plan under this subsection shall describe the proposed brownfield redevelopment project
			 for which the loan guarantee is to be made, and shall include—

a description of the project to be funded by the loan, including a schedule of activities to be
			 undertaken and a budget for such project;

a demonstration that the brownfield redevelopment project will result in major redevelopment, based
			 on economic development and environmental quality and restoration, in the
			 community in which such project is located, which shall include
			 information regarding—
the extent of non-Federal funds committed to the project;
the number of long-term jobs created by the project;
the environmental remediation of brownfield sites due to the project;
a description of the environmental and economic impact of the project on the community;
the amount of affordable housing created by the project;
the reduction of vehicle congestion and emissions expected to result from the project;

the extent of integration of green technology into developments and buildings created by the
			 project;
the extent of improvement in air quality expected to result from the project; and

the extent to which complete streets planning and transit-oriented development is incorporated into
			 the project;

evidence of the commitments of investment from non-Federal entities, established through zoning or
			 other documentation; and

a remediation action plan that has been approved by the Environmental Protection Agency, or its
			 designee.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall establish criteria for selecting local governments, local redevelopment
			 agencies, and BRAC redevelopment projects to receive loan guarantees under
			 the Program. Such criteria shall take into consideration the information
			 required under

. Such criteria shall provide that
			 existing BRAC redevelopment projects having existing Federal grants,
			 loans, or other assistance or commitments for Federal grants, loans, or
			 other assistance, shall be given additional favorable consideration toward
			 such selection.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Brownfield Redevelopment and Economic Development Innovative Financing Act of 2014/s:2/ss:c/p:2

text.#text: The

shall be
			 conclusive evidence of the eligibility of the obligations for such
			 guarantee with respect to principal and interest, and the validity of any
			 such guarantee so made shall be incontestable in the hands of a holder of
			 the guaranteed obligations.

text.#text:
The full faith and credit of the United States is pledged to the payment of all guarantees made
			 under this section. Any such guarantee made by the
The Federal Government shall not be liable under the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
or any
			 other Federal, State, or local law as a result of a loan guarantee made
			 under this section.

Comprehensive Environmental Response,
			 Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980

header.#text: Protection against liability for environmental remediation
Processing; repayment and collateral; congressional oversight

shall consider, process, and approve all requests for loan guarantees under this
			 section using an approval process that is substantially identical to the
			 approval process used for loan guarantees provided under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 108 of
			 the Housing and Community Development Act of 1974
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Housing and Community Development Act of 1974/s:108

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may not require a pledge of such grants as
			 collateral and shall provide for applicants to provide collateral in other
			 forms, at the option of the applicant.

text.#text:
To be eligible for a loan guarantee under this section, an applicant shall demonstrate a viable
			 repayment schedule and shall provide sufficient collateral to ensure
			 repayment of loans so guaranteed, which may be in the form of a pledge of
			 grants for which the applicant may become eligible under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
title I of the
			 Housing and Community Development Act of 1974

term.#tail:
means any agency, office, or division of a State government whose purpose includes improving
			 blighted, deteriorated, or otherwise economically depressed areas.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail:
means, with respect to a brownfield redevelopment project, a document that describes how the
			 project site will be remediated, what technology will be used to
			 accomplish such remediation, and when the remediation actions will take
			 place.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail:
means the Brownfield Redevelopment and Economic Development Innovative Financing program
			 established under this section.
